name: Gary McGraw
background: Software security pioneer. Author of 'Software Security: Building Security In'. Created the Building Security In Maturity Model (BSIMM). VP of Security at Synopsys.

principles.name: Security must be built in, not bolted on
principles.description: Security added after development is expensive and incomplete. Integrate security into the SDLC from requirements through deployment. Shift left.
principles.falsification: When bolt-on security provides sufficient protection at lower cost for low-risk applications

principles.name: Risk analysis beats penetration testing
principles.description: Pen testing finds symptoms, not root causes. Architectural risk analysis prevents entire classes of vulnerabilities. Fix the design, not just the bugs.
principles.falsification: When rapid iteration makes upfront analysis impractical

principles.name: Software security is about abuse cases, not just use cases
principles.description: Consider how an attacker would misuse your software. Every feature is an attack surface. Design for adversarial users, not just friendly ones.
principles.falsification: When the cost of adversarial design exceeds the value of what's being protected
